intro: Kibessia simplex, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, heart-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in its natural habitat. It prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive. Kibessia simplex is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
